description: The manifest.json currently uses "." as start_url which may not resolve correctly when deployed to a subdirectory. Update to use proper path handling for GitHub Pages deployment.
design:

2. Use relative path: "./" or "index.html"

title: Redesign application with OuiSi branding and visual identity
description: Transform the current dark-themed grid randomizer into a warm, inviting OuiSi-branded application that reflects the OuiSi Capture game aesthetic. Based on research from https://shop.ouisi.co/, the redesign should incorporate nature photography aesthetics, warm earth tones, and a matte photo card visual style.
design:
Visual Identity Research:
- Game: OuiSi Capture - collaborative visual pattern recognition where players give one-word clues for 5 cards on a 5x5 grid
- Brand colors: Warm beiges (#f5f1ed), deep navy (#2c3e50), natural greens (#27ae60)
- Visual style: Nature photography, matte photo cards, rounded corners, generous spacing
- Typography: Clean, modern, approachable
- Theme: Visual connections, "this looks like that", mindfulness, multigenerational (ages 4-104)

Key Design Principles:
1. Warm, inviting color palette (move away from dark theme)
2. Photo card aesthetic (shadows, rounded corners, texture)
3. Clear, friendly typography
4. Accessible and intuitive
5. Mobile-first responsive design
acceptance_criteria:
- Application visually reflects OuiSi brand identity
- Color palette uses warm, natural tones
- Grid cells resemble matte photo cards
- Typography is clean and inviting
- Game context is clear to new users
- All accessibility standards maintained
- Mobile experience is optimized
- PWA still functions correctly

title: Redesign grid cells as photo cards

acceptance_criteria:

- Border radius increased (8-12px for photo card feel)
- Card spacing improved with generous gaps
- Selected state has enhanced visual feedback
- Subtle texture or gradient suggests photo paper
- Hover/active states feel tactile and responsive
- All animations smooth and natural

title: Create GitHub Actions workflow for automated deployment
description: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that automatically deploys the site to GitHub Pages on push to main branch. This enables CI/CD and ensures consistent deployments.
design:
Create a GitHub Actions workflow using the official pages deployment action. The workflow should:
1. Checkout code
2. Upload artifact (static files)
3. Deploy to GitHub Pages

Use the actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3 and actions/deploy-pages@v4 actions.
acceptance_criteria:
- Workflow file created at .github/workflows/deploy.yml
- Automatic deployment triggers on push to main
- Deployment succeeds and site is accessible
- Workflow status badge can be added to README

title: Test PWA installation and offline functionality on GitHub Pages
description: After deployment, thoroughly test the PWA installation process and offline functionality to ensure everything works correctly in the production GitHub Pages environment.
acceptance_criteria:
- PWA installs successfully from GitHub Pages
- All assets cache correctly
- Offline mode works (test by disconnecting network)
- localStorage persists grid state correctly
- Service worker updates properly on new deployments

Configure service worker for GitHub Pages subdirectory deployment
description: Update sw.js to handle paths correctly when deployed to a subdirectory like /ouisiboard/ instead of root. The service worker currently uses relative paths that may not work correctly in a subdirectory context.
design: Update sw.js ASSETS array to use absolute paths or scope-aware paths. Consider using self.location.pathname or registration.scope to determine the base path dynamically.
acceptance_criteria:
- Service worker correctly caches assets when deployed to /ouisiboard/ path
- PWA works offline when installed from GitHub Pages
- No console errors related to service worker registration

title: Set up GitHub repository and enable GitHub Pages
description: Create a GitHub repository for the ouisiboard project and enable GitHub Pages deployment. The correct GitHub Pages URL will be https://[username].github.io/ouisiboard/ (or if using a custom org name, https://[orgname].github.io/ouisiboard/).
design:
1. Create GitHub repository named "ouisiboard"
2. Add remote to local repository: git remote add origin [url]
3. Push initial code to main/master branch
4. Navigate to Settings > Pages in GitHub
5. Select source: Deploy from branch
6. Select branch: main (or master) and root directory
7. Save settings
acceptance_criteria:
- Repository created on GitHub
- Remote added to local git/jj repository
- GitHub Pages enabled in repository settings
- Default branch configured for Pages deployment
notes:
Repository exists at https://github.com/offbyone/ouisiboard
Code has been pushed to main branch.
GitHub Actions workflow created at .github/workflows/deploy.yml

MANUAL STEP REQUIRED:
To complete GitHub Pages setup, you need to enable it in the repository settings:
1. Go to https://github.com/offbyone/ouisiboard/settings/pages
2. Under "Build and deployment":
   - Source: Select "GitHub Actions" (recommended for the workflow we created)
   OR
   - Source: Select "Deploy from a branch", Branch: "main", Folder: "/ (root)"
3. Save the settings

After enabling, the site will be available at: https://offbyone.github.io/ouisiboard/

The GitHub Actions workflow will automatically deploy on every push to main once Pages is enabled.
